D. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi circuli et indecora confusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 86, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10223.6" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to confundo, II. B.) Oris, <hi rend="ital">a reddening, blushing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confusus: <entryFree id="n10224" type="main" key="confu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>confundo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
confutatio: <entryFree id="n10225" type="hapax" key="confu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confuto</etym>, <sense id="n10225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confutation</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu/sis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confutator: <entryFree id="n10226" type="hapax" key="confu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refuter, opponent</hi>: Valentini, Hier. Script. Eccl.</sense></entryFree>
confuto: <entryFree id="n10227" type="main" key="confu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>futo, v. <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi> from foveo</etym>, <sense id="n10227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to check</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repress a boiling liquid, to suppress, restrain, check</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10227.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: cocus magnum ahenum quando fervit, paulā confutat truā, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 128 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 87:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 87, 11</bibl>.—Hence (far more freq.), </sense><sense id="n10227.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10227.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to repress, diminish, impede, destroy, put to silence</hi>: nostras secundas res, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximos dolores inventorum suorum memoriā et recordatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31</bibl></cit> 88: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:38:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 38, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10227.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put down by words, to put to silence, confute</hi> (so class.): sensus judjcum imperiosis comminationibus, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istos, qui nunc me culpant, confutaverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum senem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To refute, confute, disprove, answer conclusively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tactum confutabunt nares?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis levitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba magnifica rebus confutaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi argumento confutatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.7" n="3" level="3"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to convict</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 8, 1.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocuisse quibusdam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot suscepisse labores et pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confutuo: <entryFree id="n10228" type="hapax" key="confu^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fŭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie with conjugally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confuturum: <entryFree id="n10229" type="main" key="confu^tu_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭtūrum</orth>, v. consum.</entryFree>
congarrio: <entryFree id="n10230" type="main" key="congarri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-garrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to gabble much, to prattle</hi>, Antonin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. 1, 15</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
congaudeo: <entryFree id="n10231" type="main" key="congaudeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gaudeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to rejoice with one</hi> (eccl. Lat.): alicui, Tert. adv. Gnost. c. 13; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 50 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
congedus: <entryFree id="n10232" type="main" key="Conge^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Congĕdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Spain, tributary to the Iberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:49:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 49, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congelasco: <entryFree id="n10233" type="main" key="conge^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (no <sense id="n10233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to freeze, congeal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum, vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congelatio: <entryFree id="n10234" type="main" key="conge^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congelo</etym>, <sense id="n10234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freezing, congealing</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): liquoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 21, § 33</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congelo: <entryFree id="n10235" type="main" key="conge^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10235.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to cause to freeze up, to congeal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10235.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:12" default="NO">12, 50, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare congelatum,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea being frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congelati gutta nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken, make hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans><tr>to curdle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lapidem rictus serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se adeps congelaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>.—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prodest, si te congelat uxor anus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:147:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 147, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to freeze, freeze up</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10235.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Ister <cb n="CONG" /> congelat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 307</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 415</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n10235.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gaudebam sane et congelasse nostrum amicum laetabar otio, <hi rend="ital">had frozen together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had become wholly inactive</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl>; cf. conglacio, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
congeminatio: <entryFree id="n10236" type="hapax" key="conge^mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congemino</etym>, <sense id="n10236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling;</hi> connected with conduplicatio, in com. lang., for <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congemino: <entryFree id="n10237" type="main" key="conge^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to double, redouble, repeat, reduplicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc si pateram patera peperit, omnes congeminavimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have produced our like, doubled ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L (litteram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:S. 9:9" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> S. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebros ictus ensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 714</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, securim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria rauco fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:512" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:201" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 6, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congemisco: <entryFree id="n10238" type="main" key="conge^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to sigh deeply</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 30</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 411 al.</sense></entryFree>
congemo: <entryFree id="n10239" type="main" key="conge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n10239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10239.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to sigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">groan deeply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loudly, to heave a sigh</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10239.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (rare but class.): congemuit senatus frequens, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10239.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of trees cut down: supremum congemuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 631</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10239.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to deplore, lament, bewail</hi>: quid mortem congemis ac fles? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 934</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positum feretro congemuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congener: <entryFree id="n10240" type="hapax" key="conge^ner1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>, <sense id="n10240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the same race</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10241" type="main" key="conge^ner2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint son-inlaw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 40</bibl> dub. (al. generi).</sense></entryFree>
congenero: <entryFree id="n10242" type="main" key="conge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n10242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To beget</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produce at the same time</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. exs., and only in the <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">porci congenerati,</quote> <trans><tr>of the same litter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeneratum verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the same root</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10242.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unite by affinity, to connect</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 28</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 580 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
congenitus: <entryFree id="n10243" type="main" key="conge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gigno], <sense id="n10243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced together with</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): pili,</quote> <trans><tr>congenital</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastitas roborum mundo,</quote> <trans><tr>coëval with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; Tert. Test. Anim. c. 5.</sense></entryFree>
congentiles: <entryFree id="n10244" type="gloss" key="congenti_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gentīles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kindred, of the same stock</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2491</bibl>; cf. congentilis, <foreign lang="greek">o(mo/eqnos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
congenuclo: <entryFree id="n10245" type="hapax" key="conge^nu_^clo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnū^clo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>geniculo</etym>, <sense id="n10245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall upon the knees</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congenulatus: <entryFree id="n10246" type="hapax" key="conge^nu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [genu], <sense id="n10246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fallen upon the knees</hi>: multi congenulati, etc., Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 57, 32</bibl> (perh. congenuclati should be the reading; cf. congenuclo).</sense></entryFree>
conger: <entryFree id="n10247" type="greek" key="conger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conger</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">congrus</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 12</bibl> P.; <sense id="n10247.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">also gonger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl></cit>), <itype>gri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">go/ggros</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sea-eel, conger-eel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:115" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 20, 36, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 62, 88, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congeries: <entryFree id="n10248" type="main" key="conge^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 11:119" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 11, 119</bibl> and 125 Goes.; Innoc. Cas. Litt. p. 224 ib.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congero</etym>, <sense id="n10248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is brought together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a heap, pile, mass</hi> (not ante-Aug.; while the syn. acervus is prevalent through all periods). </sense><sense id="n10248.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10248.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 235</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">struis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum et fruticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaverum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:511" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 511</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 318</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa grani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta metalli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta sordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris exigui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:866 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 866 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10248.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositam Congeriem secuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chaos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 10</bibl>.—So of <hi rend="ital">a heap of wood, wood-pile, funeral-pile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 576</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 1, 93</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10248.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10248.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">venit aetas omnis in unam congeriem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 136</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10248.6" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., a figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">accumulation;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sunaqroismo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:26" default="NO">8, 4, 26</bibl> sq. <cb n="CONG" /></sense></entryFree>
congermanesco: <entryFree id="n10249" type="main" key="congerma_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-germānesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [germanus], <hi rend="ital">to grow together with one, grow up with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coalescere, conjungi vel consociari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 16 sq.</bibl></cit> (ante- and post-class., and very rare): cum illis, Quadrig. ap. Non. l. l.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congermanus: <entryFree id="n10250" type="hapax" key="congerma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-germānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., grown together with, united with</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congerminalis: <entryFree id="n10251" type="hapax" key="congermi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-germĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>germen</etym>, <sense id="n10251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from the same stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>: spicae ceteris congerminales, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 7.</sense></entryFree>
congermino: <entryFree id="n10252" type="hapax" key="congermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-germĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to shoot forth at the same time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congero: <entryFree id="n10253" type="main" key="conge^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bear, carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring together, to collect; to prepare, to make, build, heap up</hi>, etc. (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n10253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10253.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique, quod idoneum ad muniendum putarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestis undique saccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera aedificanti utilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: caedi arbores et saxa congeri jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:777" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turea dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 70 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias sibi fulvo auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestoque avidum pinguescere corpore corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1216" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1216</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 506" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccā congestā pulvere barbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula congerimus properata,</quote> <trans><tr>to join, add one to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl></cit> (18), 113.—</sense><sense id="n10253.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, and a designation of place to, at, or in which, etc., any thing is brought or heaped up: <cit><quote lang="la">hasce herbas in suum alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cellulam patris penum omnem congerebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laticem in vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1009" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1009</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 936</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Midae dormienti formicae in os tritici grana congesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in os pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excrementa in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 870" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 870</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta illi (sc. virgini) pro aureis donis congesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium millies in culinam,</quote> <trans><tr>to expend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc amnes vastos congerit tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:717" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindo congestus Athos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1153" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni (digito anulos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum corbulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10253.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10253.5" n="1" level="3"> Of weapons, missiles, etc., <hi rend="ital">to throw in great numbers, accumulate, shower</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lanceas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa in caput alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 871" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsum Porum tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestis telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:307" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas mortuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10253.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make, build, construct</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">by bringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heaping together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Echinades insulae ab Acheloo amne congestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram sepulcri arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperis et tuguri congestum caespite culmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—So of birds, insects, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucifugis congesta cubilia blattis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 10, 30</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> notavi Ipse locum aëriae quo congessere palumbes (sc. nidum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl> (cf. the full expression: <cit><quote lang="la">in nervom ille hodie nidamenta congeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 51</bibl></cit>): apes in alvearium congesserant, Cic. Oecon. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">rape, congere, aufer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:44:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 44, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10253.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10253.8" n="A" level="2"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to bring, take</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">comprise together, to compile</hi> (freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">operarios omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:297" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 86, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta (opp. dissolvere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana (maledicta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique nomina plurimorum poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem dierum ac noctium studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem ex diversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">zwh\ kai\ yuxh/</foreign> lascivum congeris usque, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you repeat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:68:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 68, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te eripias ex eā, quam ego congessi in hunc sermonem, turbā patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:25" default="NO">9, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:39" default="NO">9, 3, 39</bibl>; 10, 5, 23.—</sense><sense id="n10253.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put something upon one in a hostile or friendly manner, to accumulate, heap upon, to impart, ascribe to, to impute, attribute to;</hi> constr. class. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in;</hi> post-Aug. also with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: ad quem di <pb n="419" /> <cb n="CONG" /> atque homines omnia ornamenta congessissent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne plus aequo quid in amicitiam congeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentia beneficia in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congerere juveni consulatus, triumphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosae majestati quicquid potuimus titulorum congessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuo laudes congessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">me/li mou, yuxh/ mou</foreign> congeris usque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:68:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 68, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes omnis in unum Te mea congesta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: iis nihil, quo expleri possit eorum meritum, tributurum populum Romanum, si omnia simul congesserit, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 7</bibl>.—Esp., of crimes, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">congestis probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (crimina) postea sunt in eum congesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas alicujus rei in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 7</bibl></cit>.— Hence, *<orth extent="full" lang="la">congestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">brought together;</hi> hence, in pregn. signif., <hi rend="ital">pressed together, thick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gobio congestior alvo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 132</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">congestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briefly, summarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec breviter et congeste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Marc. Aur. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10254" type="main" key="conge^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. congero</etym>, <sense id="n10254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 566, 13</bibl>: congerones qui aliena ad se congregant; so also 2. gero.</sense></entryFree>
congerra: <entryFree id="n10255" type="main" key="congerra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congerra</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">concerra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playfellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=263:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 263, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:297:29" default="NO">297, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congerro: <entryFree id="n10256" type="main" key="congerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congerro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">concerro</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Lindem.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>congero; prop. one who contributes to a common feast; cf. Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:v. 919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. v. 919</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n10256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolly companion, a playfellow</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 27</bibl> (931 Ritschl.); 5, 1, 8; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7, p. 55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, p. 55</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
congeste: <entryFree id="n10257" type="main" key="congeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. congero, <sense id="n10257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
congesticius: <entryFree id="n10258" type="main" key="congesti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. congero</etym>, <sense id="n10258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brought together, heaped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piled up</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): agger ex materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congesticius aut paluster locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congestim: <entryFree id="n10259" type="hapax" key="congestim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaped together, in heaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestim et acervatim jacere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congestio: <entryFree id="n10260" type="main" key="congesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, lit. <sense id="n10260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a heaping up, accumulation</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10260.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr. </sense><sense id="n10260.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10260.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">enumerationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10260.4" n="II" level="1"> In concr., that which is <hi rend="ital">heaped up, a heap, mass, pile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congestitius: <entryFree id="n10261" type="main" key="congesti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. congesticius.</entryFree>
congesto: <entryFree id="n10262" type="main" key="congesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gesto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Pecc. Merit. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Pecc. Merit. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 64, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congestus: <entryFree id="n10263" type="main" key="congestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. congero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10264" type="main" key="congestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. congero</etym>, <sense id="n10264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing together, an accumulation</hi> (rare; mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10264.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10264.2" n="A" level="2"> In abstr.: herbam asperam credo (exstitisse) avium congestu, non humano satu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnarum opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10264.3" n="B" level="2"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a heap, pile, mass</hi>: magnus harenae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 725</bibl>: culmorum et frondium, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo congestu pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 486</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10264.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in dicendo quamlibet abundans rerum copia cumulum tantum habeat atque congestum, nisi, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: tantus rerum ex orbe toto coëuntium congestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 6</bibl></cit> (26), 5.</sense></entryFree>
congialis: <entryFree id="n10265" type="main" key="congi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>congius</etym>, <sense id="n10265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holding a</hi> congius (very rare): fidelia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">situli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congiarium: <entryFree id="n10266" type="main" key="congi^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. congiarius.</entryFree>
congiarius: <entryFree id="n10267" type="main" key="congi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>congius</etym>, <sense id="n10267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a</hi> congius, <hi rend="ital">holding a</hi> congius. </sense><sense id="n10267.1" n="I" level="1"> As <pos>adj.</pos> rare: vinum, <hi rend="ital">given by measure</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Antonin. 1:2, p. 149" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Antonin. 1, 2, p. 149</bibl> Mai: cadi, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 17, § 96</bibl>.—But very freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n10267.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">congĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10267.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. vas.) <hi rend="ital">A vessel that holds a</hi> congius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 26, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10267.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. donum.) <hi rend="ital">A gift divided among the people of the measure of a</hi> congius; cf. Quint. <cb n="CONG" /> 6, 3, 52. Orig. this present was in food; <cit><quote lang="la">as in oil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2, 8</bibl></cit> (v. congius); <cit><quote lang="la">in salt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 89</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in wine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 14, 17, § 96</bibl></cit>. Afterwards congiarium was also used for <hi rend="ital">a largess in money</hi> of undefined amount; <hi rend="ital">divided among the soldiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">among the people</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Monum. Ancyr.</author> 3, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, in which sense post-Aug. authors contrast it with the donativum of the soldiers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">or among private friends</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:16:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 16, 2</bibl>; Quint. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.: in hunc maxime quod multa congiaria habuerat, favor populi se inclinabat,</quote> <trans><tr>because he had made many distributions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 57, 11</bibl></cit> (v. Drak. ad h. l.); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10267.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a gift, present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 22:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 22, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congius: <entryFree id="n10268" type="main" key="congi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman measure for liquids, containing the eighth part of an</hi> amphora, six sextarii, or twelve heminae; <cit><quote lang="la">= about 206 cubic inches or nearly six pints English,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 22, 28</bibl>, §§ 144 and 146 al.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246, 4</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 26, 6 sq.</bibl>; Rein in Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 219 sq., and Dict. of Antiq. s. v.</sense></entryFree>
conglacio: <entryFree id="n10269" type="main" key="congla^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glăcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10269.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to turn entirely to ice, to freeze up</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10269.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: aqua neque conglaciaret frigoribus, neque nive pruinaque concresceret, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10269.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Curioni nostro tribunatus conglaciat, <hi rend="ital">is frozen up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">passes inactively</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 3</bibl>; cf. congelo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n10269.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to cause to freeze up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conglaciantur aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:101" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conglaciato imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 60, 61, § 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conglisco: <entryFree id="n10270" type="hapax" key="conglisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be kindled up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to become illustrious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conglobatim: <entryFree id="n10271" type="main" key="conglo^ba_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conglŏbātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>conglobo</etym>, <sense id="n10271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in heaps, in a mass</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
conglobatio: <entryFree id="n10272" type="main" key="conglo^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conglŏbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heaping, gathering</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crowding together</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">multa ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nubium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita (militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conglobo: <entryFree id="n10273" type="main" key="conglo^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glŏbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v a., to gather into a ball, to make spherical, to conglobate</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10273.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., constr. usu. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare medium locum expetens conglobatur undique aequabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (prester) rate funditur, illud (fulmen) conglobatur impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 49, 50, § 134</bibl></cit>; App. de Mundo, p. 62, 2.— More freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ipsa in sese nutibus suis conglobata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2</bibl></cit>. 39, 98; so, <cit><quote lang="la">astra nisu suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in semet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 64, 84, § 183</bibl></cit>.—And in tmesis: corpuscula complexa inter se conque globata, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 154</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10273.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to press together in a mass, to crowd together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes, ut uvae, aliae ex aliis pendent conglobatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conglobato corpore in pilae modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in semet conglobatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 64, 84, § 183</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Freq., in the historians, of the collecting or crowding together of soldiers: uti quosque fors conglobaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eos Agathyrnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimam castrorum partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum in quo se miles conglobaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsi ac fugā conglobati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15, 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors conglobabat (sc. milites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5, 7</bibl></cit>. —Also of the elephant: <cit><quote lang="la">conglobatae beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10273.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitiones conglobatae,</quote> <trans><tr>heaped together, accumulated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 16, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conglomeratio: <entryFree id="n10274" type="hapax" key="conglo^me^ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conglŏmĕrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conglomero</etym>, <sense id="n10274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crowding together, an assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 19, 13, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conglomero: <entryFree id="n10275" type="main" key="conglo^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glŏmĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n10275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to roll together, wind up, conglomerate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10275.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae intortae et conglomeratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— * </sense><sense id="n10275.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to crowd, heap</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>:<cb n="CONG" />  omnia mala in aliquem, Enn. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 15</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 307 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
conglorifico: <entryFree id="n10276" type="main" key="conglo_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glōrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to glorify together with</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Tert. Res. Carn. c. 40 al.</sense></entryFree>
conglutinatio: <entryFree id="n10277" type="main" key="conglu_ti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conglūtĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conglutino</etym> (only in Cic. and very rare), <sense id="n10277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gluing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cementing together</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10277.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: recens, Cic <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:20:72" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 20, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10277.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi> verborum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conglutino: <entryFree id="n10278" type="main" key="conglu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-glūtĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to glue, cement, join together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10278.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">favos extremos inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrasque res inter se (calx),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:52:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 52, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 6, 24, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volnera recentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germinantis oculos aliquā sibi annexione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10278.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10278.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join, unite firmly together, to bind closely, cement</hi> (a favorite trope of Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere very rare): hominem eadem, optime quae conglutinavit, natura dissolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem dissolutam, divulsamque (sc. in oratione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi vitium cum causā peccati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit> (opp. dissolvere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntates nostras consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: meretricios amores nuptiis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est in Antonio praeter libidinem, crudelitatem, petulantiam, audaciam? Ex his totus conglutinatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>composed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: affixus et conglutinatus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">adhering closely to</hi> a person, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10278.4" n="B" level="2"> Like compono, comparo, etc., <hi rend="ital">to invent, devise, contrive</hi> (a means): <cit><quote lang="la">conglutina, Ut senem hodie doctum docte fallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conglutinosus: <entryFree id="n10279" type="hapax" key="conglu_ti^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conglūtĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conglutino</etym>, <sense id="n10279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glutinous, viscous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars umoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congradus: <entryFree id="n10280" type="hapax" key="congra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grădus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., keeping pace with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera soli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congraeco: <entryFree id="n10281" type="hapax" key="congraeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-graeco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>graecor, āri</etym>, <sense id="n10281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lavish on banquets like the Greeks, to squander in luxury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congratulatio: <entryFree id="n10282" type="main" key="congra_tu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrātŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congratulor</etym>, <sense id="n10282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wishing of joy; congratulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>; Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congratulor: <entryFree id="n10283" type="main" key="congra_tu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grātŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri</itype>, <sense id="n10283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to wish joy, to congratulate</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona quid cessant mihi Conferre omnes congratulantes, qui pugnavi fortiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit> Brix; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 8, 10</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 4, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Porc. Latro</author>, Decl. in Catil. 36</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Alicui de aliquā re</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 11, 20</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congredior: <entryFree id="n10284" type="main" key="congre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n10284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go, come</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">meet with one</hi>, esp. with the access. idea of intention, in a friendly or hostile sense (class. in prose and poetry); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (<hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, etc.), the <hi rend="ital">acc., dat.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10284.1" n="I" level="1"> In a friendly sense, <hi rend="ital">to visit, accost, address, meet with.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10284.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insinuatus in familiaritatem adulescentis et cum eo saepe congressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna tum congrediens cum sole, tum digrediens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquirere ubi sit congressus cum servis Caelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum Caesare in itinere congressi ... orabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10284.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4</bibl>. 1, 19.—</sense><sense id="n10284.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 19 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 109:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 109, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo loco ut congrederentur convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 39, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 2</bibl>: in Macedoniā congrediemur, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressa primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 761</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:192" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:427" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 427</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10284.5" n="II" level="1"> In a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to fight, contend, engage.</hi> etc. (most freq. in the historians). </sense><sense id="n10284.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepenumero cum his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16, 3</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n10284.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ipsum Caesarem est congressus armatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10284.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 40" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 40</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10284.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">infelix puer atque impar congressus Achilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 475</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 747" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 747</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe armato congredi nudum dementia videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur.
