Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>.— <pb n="420" /> <cb n="CONG" /> (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ad insidias ille, ubi congressi sunt, utri fuerit aptior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui quoniam armis congressi ac superati essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in congrediendis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. id. § 9: in congressibus proeliorum).—</sense><sense id="n10284.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of contention in words, specif. of judic. strife (almost confined to Cic. and Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">tecum luctari et congredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Academico et eodem rhetore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 9, 1</bibl> pr.; Cod. 7, 56, 3.—</sense><sense id="n10284.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ad repugnandum congressa defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 25, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio aequo congressa campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congregabilis: <entryFree id="n10285" type="hapax" key="congre^ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>congrego</etym>, <sense id="n10285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily brought together, social</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">examina apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congregalis: <entryFree id="n10286" type="hapax" key="congre^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n10286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uniting together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2411" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2411</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
congregatim: <entryFree id="n10287" type="hapax" key="congre^ga_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">together, in crowds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursant per ampla moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 143</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congregatio: <entryFree id="n10288" type="main" key="congre^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assembling together; union, society, association</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10288.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ad conjunctionem congregationemque hominum et ad naturalem communitatem esse natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl>; Cod. Th. 18, 14, 4 al.—</sense><sense id="n10288.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum (corresp. with colligere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum (opp. separatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: rerum (with repetitio, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nakefalai/wsis</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a recapitulating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum, locorum, temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congregativus: <entryFree id="n10289" type="hapax" key="congre^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for uniting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">congregating, copulative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia (simul, una, pariter, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1021</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
congregator: <entryFree id="n10290" type="main" key="congre^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings together, an assembler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 39, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congregatus: <entryFree id="n10291" type="hapax" key="congre^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a union, association</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congrego: <entryFree id="n10292" type="main" key="congre^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to collect into a flock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herd, to assemble.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10292.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly in Pliny the elder): oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">apium examina congregantur,</quote> <trans><tr>collect in swarms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera animantia congregari videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">5: cum ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loca certa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad amnes (ferae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>.—More freq. (in good prose; esp. freq. in Cic.), </sense><sense id="n10292.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assemble a multitude together, to unite, join, associate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10292.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipatos homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersos homines in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se unum in locum ad curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipatos (homines) unum in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem fugitivorum unum in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem in idem Vettii indicium atque in eundem hunc numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum aequalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illis moror quibus me tempus aliquod congregavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 62:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 62, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrimum quemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">secedant improbi, unum in locum congregentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fano congregantur commentandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Academiā congregati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armati locis patentibus congregantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congregabantur undique ad Titum Tatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta vis oriens et congregata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gamphasantes nulli externo congregantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciconiae abiturae congregantur in certo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncti deinde ad portum congregantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl></cit>. —And in tmesis: <cit><quote lang="la">conque gregantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 456</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">pares cum paribus facillime congregantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10292.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare; mostly in Quint.), <hi rend="ital">to collect, accumulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta infirmiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turbam (verborum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. congregatio, II. <cb n="CONG" /></sense></entryFree>
congregus: <entryFree id="n10293" type="main" key="congre^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>con-grex</etym>, <sense id="n10293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">united in flocks</hi>, etc. (opp. solivagus): <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congressio: <entryFree id="n10294" type="main" key="congressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congredior</etym>, <sense id="n10294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming together</hi>, in a friendly or hostile manner. </sense><sense id="n10294.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friendly meeting, interview, conference</hi> (almost confined to Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. digressio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in congressionibus familiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>in familiar circles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10294.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A carnal union, copulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris et feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 20, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. 2. congressus, I. B.— </sense><sense id="n10294.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hostile meeting, an attack, contest</hi> (very freq. in Just., elsewhere rare, for the class. congressus), Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:1" default="NO">4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:4:12" default="NO">6, 4, 12</bibl>; 12, 8, 4; 22, 3, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 6, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
congressor: <entryFree id="n10295" type="hapax" key="congressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who meets</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assembles with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 27, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congressus: <entryFree id="n10296" type="main" key="congressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from congredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10297" type="main" key="congressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>congredior</etym>, <sense id="n10297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">going together</hi>, in a friendly or hostile manner (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10297.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friendly meeting, a social assembly, conference, conversation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes congressum tuum fugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis congressus fuerit mihi cum Caesare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:733 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 733 al.</bibl>—Also of the companionship of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10297.2" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a close union, combination</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duriorum (consonantium) inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1065" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1065</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">carnal union, copulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>; cf. congressio, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n10297.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hostile encounter, a contest, fight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his navibus nostrae classi ejusmodi congressus erat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam cladem in congressu facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:74:3" default="NO" valid="yes">74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:322 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 322 al.</bibl> —Also of <hi rend="ital">judicial contests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congrex: <entryFree id="n10298" type="main" key="congrex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grex</orth>, <itype>grĕgis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (post-class.). <sense id="n10298.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the same herd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equinis armentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl></cit> dub. (al. congregatae).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10298.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">collected in flocks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">multitudes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervas, Auct. Pervig. Ven. 43: vulgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comessationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10298.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">close, intimate</hi>: aliquem congrege nexu tenere, Prud. contra <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:634" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 634</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congrio: <entryFree id="n10299" type="main" key="Congri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Congrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conger</etym>, <sense id="n10299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a cook in</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congrue: <entryFree id="n10300" type="main" key="congru^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. congruus <sense id="n10300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
congruens: <entryFree id="n10301" type="main" key="congru^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>congruo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
congruenter: <entryFree id="n10302" type="main" key="congru^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. congruo, <sense id="n10302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
congruentia: <entryFree id="n10303" type="main" key="congru^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congruo</etym>, <sense id="n10303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreement, harmony, congruity, symmetry</hi> (postAug. and very rare): morum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corporis), with aequalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 15 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
congruo: <entryFree id="n10304" type="main" key="congru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> congruēre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 102</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Corss. Beitr. 457</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to run, come</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">meet together</hi> with something. </sense><sense id="n10304.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): guttae inter se congruunt et confunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem nata petit, quo jam manus horrida matrum Congruerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:307" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 307</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:58" default="NO">6, 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the stars: sidera meantia cum sole aut congruentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81</bibl></cit> § 191; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 19, 1</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl>, II. B. infra).— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence also of the calendar dates, fixed in accordance with the stars: ut vicesimo anno ad metam eandem solis, unde orsi essent, dies cóngruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n10304.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to coincide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">correspond with a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, in substance, in feeling</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in time, to be suited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adapted to, to agree with, accord, suit, fit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10304.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be suited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fitted to, to agree with</hi> (in substance), <hi rend="ital">to correspond;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, inter se</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10304.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa congruere et cohaerere cum causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl>: cum virtute congruere<cb n="CONG" />  semper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut corporis temperatio, cum ea congruunt inter se, e quibus constamus, sanitas: sic animi dicitur, cum ejus judicia opinionesque concordant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multae causae ... inter se congruere videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 8</bibl>.—Somewhat diff.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem auxere captivi eo maxime, quod sermo inter omnes congruebat (for sermones omnium inter se congruebant),</quote> <trans><tr>agreed, was congruous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (principiis) congruere debent quae sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>: non omni causae nec auditori neque personae neque tempori congruere orationis unum genus, <hi rend="ital">is suitable, fit</hi>, = convenire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidius timidius decessit quam professioni ejus congruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 87, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum congruit, ut simul et affirmes, te assiduis occupationibus impediri, et scripta nostra desideres?</quote> <trans><tr>is it consistent?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res prout congruunt aut repugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:107" default="NO">5, 10, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Latinos bellandum erat, lingua, moribus, etc., congruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10304.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To agree</hi> (in feeling, opinion, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">illi inter se congruunt concorditer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier mulieri magis congruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā, moribus, armorum genere institutis ante omnia militaribus congruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem similia omnia: omnes congruunt: unum cognoris, omnes noris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re unā solum dissident de ceteris mirifice congruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne natura ... animos quoque dederit corporum doloribus congruentis,</quote> <trans><tr>sympathizing with, sharing in, affected by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera innumerabilia caelo inhaerentia cum ejus ipsius motu congruere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit> Tischer ad loc.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttiis non societate magis Punicā quam suopte ingenio congruentibus in eum morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omniumque in unum sententiae congruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eae res in unum congruentes ... damnationem faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come together, agree, meet, coincide</hi> (in time): <cit><quote lang="la">suos dies mensisque congruere volunt cum solis lunaeque ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus ad id ipsum congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum temporum ratio vix congruat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte congruerat, ut Clodii Macri et Fonteii Capitonis caedes nuntiarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>it happened at the same time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in idem artati temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.). </sense><sense id="n10304.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeing, fit, appropriate, suitable, consistent, congruous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10304.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita cum disciplinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles et Theophrastus, cum illis re congruentes, genere docendi paulum differentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens actio menti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid congruentius Deo?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.13" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi aptum et congruens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio vocis, vultūs et gestūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio verbis discrepans, sententiis congruens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec duo pro congruentibus sumunt, tam vehementer repugnantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10304.14" n="2" level="3"> Congruens est or videtur, = convenit, <hi rend="ital">it is</hi> (<hi rend="ital">seems</hi>) <hi rend="ital">fit, proper, meet</hi> (post-Aug. and rare); with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens erat, eandem immunitatem parentes obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38, 6</bibl></cit>: congruentius est, Cod. 8, 47, 4.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruentissimum est, animam puniri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 58</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens videtur primordia ejus aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens crediderim recensere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10304.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeing in all its parts; symmetrical, proportioned; accordant, consistent, harmonious</hi>: is concentus ex dissimillumarum vocum moderatione concors tamen efficitur et congruens, <pb n="421" /> <cb n="CONI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius corpore fuit amplo et robusto ... ceteris quoque membris usque ad imos pedes aequalis et congruens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruens clamor (opp. dissonus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">congruentissimā voce acclamare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., agreeably, filly, suitably</hi> (twice in Cic., but very rare in the class. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">congruenter naturae convenienterque vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad id quodcumque agetur apte congruenterque dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Orat. 3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Orat. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 1:12 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 1, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
congrus: <entryFree id="n10305" type="gloss" key="congrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrus</orth>, v. conger.</entryFree>
congruus: <entryFree id="n10306" type="main" key="congru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>congruo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeing, fit, suitable; harmonious, concordant</hi> (ante-, and more freq. post-class., for the class. congruens): sermo cum illā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia verecundiae maternae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:31:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 31, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae naturae congruum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congruo cunctae multitudinis consensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 187 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-grŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">suitably, fitly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">congrue respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Capt. 6:section=601" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Capt. 6, § 601</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congyro: <entryFree id="n10307" type="main" key="congy_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gȳro</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <sense id="n10307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to make a circle about a person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa aliquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conia: <entryFree id="n10308" type="main" key="co_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnĭa</orth>, v ciconia.</entryFree>
conicio: <entryFree id="n10309" type="main" key="co_ni^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnĭcĭo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjĭcio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōicio</orth>; cf. Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl>; Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 5</bibl>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (arch. <sense id="n10309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi> conjexi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 99</bibl>) [jacio]. </sense><sense id="n10309.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring together, to unite</hi>, = cogo, colligo. </sense><sense id="n10309.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum semina rerum coaluerint quae, conjecta repente, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1073 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1073 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolum in collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collecto pallio): sarcinas in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (MSS. in medio); ib. § 13; 31, 27, 7: tecta, quae conjectis celeriter stramentis erant inaedificata, Auct. B. G. 8, 5. —</sense><sense id="n10309.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10309.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw together in speaking, to dispute, contend, discuss, manage</hi> judicially (ante-class.): verba inter sese, <hi rend="ital">to bandy words</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without verba: noli, mea mater, me praesente cum patre, conicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 267, 30; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 268, 3: causam conicere hodie ad te volo (conicere, agere, Non.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 267, 32; cf. the law formula: ante meridiem causam coiciunto, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10309.5" n="2" level="3"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sumba/llein</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott in h. v. III. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to put together logically, connect, unite;</hi> hence (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to draw a conclusion from collected particulars, to conclude, infer, conjecture</hi> (not in Quint., who very freq. employed the synon. colligo): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 751</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timoth. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos sexaginta natus es aut plus, ut conicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illud mali est? nequeo satis mirari, neque conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito conjeci, Lanuvii te fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de futuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multos esse oporteret, ex ipso navigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicito, possisne necne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu conicito cetera, Quid ego ex hac inopiā capiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10309.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic., t. t. of the lang. of augury, <hi rend="ital">to prophesy, foretell, divine from omens, signs</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a dream, oracle</hi>, etc.); <hi rend="ital">to interpret an omen, a dream, an oracle</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de matre suaviandā ex oraculo Apollinis tam acute arguteque conjecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male conjecta maleque interpretata falsa sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur quae tempestas impendeat vatis melius coniciet quam gubernator? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene qui coniciet, vatem hunc perhibebo optumum (transl. of a Greek verse),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. conjectura, II., conjector, and conjectrix.—</sense><sense id="n10309.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw, cast, urge, drive, hurl, put, place</hi>, etc., a person or thing <hi rend="ital">with force, quickly</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards;</hi> and conicere se, <hi rend="ital">to betake, cast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">throw one's self hastily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in flight somewhere</hi> (very freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10309.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10309.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela in nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: aliquem<cb n="CONI" />  in carcerem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pelop. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 8</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:19:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 2, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in compedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27 al.</bibl>: incolas vivos constrictosque in flammam, Auct. B. Afr. 87; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te in ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eculeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in angustias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem in portum (vis tempestatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes vivas in vasa fictilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultros in guttura velleris atri,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 245</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum in guttura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in signa manipulosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in sacrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in ultimam provinciam Tarsum usque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se in pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to one's heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit> (cf.: se conferre in pedes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 518, 20</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quin, pedes, vos in curriculum conicitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">se intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:28:47" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 28, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10309.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alii spolia ... Coniciunt igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic dea unum anguem Conicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem juveni conjecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectaque vincula collo accipit,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown about the neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10309.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus domicilia mutet ad alias animalium formas conjectus,</quote> <trans><tr>removed, transposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10309.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">magnus decursus aquaï Fragmina coniciens silvarum arbustaque tota,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing down, prostrating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:735" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venabula manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:454" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus inflammata conjectis ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum inbelle sine ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 544</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum inter ilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10309.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring, direct, turn, throw, urge, drive, force something eagerly, quickly to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10309.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in morbum ex aegritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes) in terrorem ac tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam in perturbationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1, 43: (Catilinam) ex occultis insidiis in apertum latrocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in tricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in saginam ad regem aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: se mirificam in latebram, <hi rend="ital">to fly to</hi> (in disputing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in noctem,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit one's self to the night, travel by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: se mente ac voluntate in versum, <hi rend="ital">to devote</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apply one's self with zeal to the art of poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem tam improbe in clarissimos viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam pecuniam in propylaea,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw away, squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sestertium milies in culinam conjecisset (Apicius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in unum vigilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina in tuam nimiam diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta in ejus vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: causas tenues simultatum in gregem locupletium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cause, occasion</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 49: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen in quae tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen in illam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10309.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitiones ita conjectae (the fig. taken from aiming at a thing with weapons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: in disputando conjecit illam vocem Cn. Pompeius, omnes oportere senatui dicto audientes esse, <hi rend="ital">threw out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">let fall</hi>, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10309.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vos sub legis superbissimae vincula conicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10309.17" n="2" level="3"> Of a verbal bringing forward, etc., <hi rend="ital">to urge, press, treat, adduce</hi>: rem ubi paciscuntur, in comitio aut in foro causam coiciunto, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>: causam coicere ad te volo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 32</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 216 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba inter se acrius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 267, 27 (Com. Rel. v. 309 ib.): is cum filio Cojecerat nescio quid de ratiunculā, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ner. 11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ner. 11</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 191 ib.).—</sense><sense id="n10309.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw, place, put into, include in</hi>, etc.: eum fasciculum, quo <cb n="CONI" /> illam (epistulam) conjeceram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illo libello, qui in epistulam conjectus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjeci id (prooemium) in eum librum, quem tibi misi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluraque praeterea in eandem epistulam conjeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multos dies epistulam in manibus habui... ideo multa conjecta sunt aliud alio tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem in decimam tabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 22, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conifer: <entryFree id="n10310" type="hapax" key="co_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n10310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing fruit of a conical form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyparissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 680</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf. coniger and co nus.</sense></entryFree>
coniger: <entryFree id="n10311" type="hapax" key="co_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conusgero</etym>, <sense id="n10311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing fruit of a conical form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. conifer and conus.</sense></entryFree>
conila: <entryFree id="n10312" type="greek" key="co^ni_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnīla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koni/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n10312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> cunila and origanum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coninquere: <entryFree id="n10313" type="gloss" key="co^ninque^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏninquĕre</orth>, v. coinquio</entryFree>
coniptum: <entryFree id="n10314" type="gloss" key="coniptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coniptum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">conitum</orth>, <sense id="n10314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oblation made by sprinkling flour</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=40:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 40, 8</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
conire: <entryFree id="n10315" type="gloss" key="co^ni_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnīre</orth>, v. coëo.</entryFree>
conisco: <entryFree id="n10316" type="main" key="co^nisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnisco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. corusco.</entryFree>
conisterium: <entryFree id="n10317" type="greek" key="co^niste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnistērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">konisth)rion</foreign>, <sense id="n10317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in the palæstra where the athletæ, after anointing, sprinkled themselves with dust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conisus: <entryFree id="n10318" type="main" key="co_ni_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conitor.</entryFree>
conitor: <entryFree id="n10319" type="main" key="co_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō-nītor</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-nītor</orth>; cf. <sense id="n10319.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Ritschl, Opusc. II. 448 sq.), nisus or nixus (conisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 63, 4</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl>; Ser. Ep. 94, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:629" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 629</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 264</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 5 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:379" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 4</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> conitier, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>; cf. Trag. Rel. p. 284 Rib.), <hi rend="ital">to put forth all one's strength, strive, struggle, endeavor</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of physical exertion. </sense><sense id="n10319.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10319.3" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> or with <case>abl.</case> of means: <cit><quote lang="la">pol si quidem Conisus esses, per corium, per viscera Perque os elephanti transmineret bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: dein ejus germanum cornibus conitier, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl> (Trag. Praet. v. 23 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">corniger est valido conixus corpore taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque genu flexo Taurus conititur ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 290</bibl></cit> (536): <cit><quote lang="la">illam famuli ferebant, conixi umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert ingens toto conixus corpore saxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis Conixi incurrunt hastis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique omnes conisi hostem avertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus copiis conisus Ancus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres juvenes conixi arborem unam evellebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus omnibus regni viribus conixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni equestre proelium conixi omni vi perficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis conisus viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si coniterentur (mulae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:52:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 52, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10319.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coniterentur modo uno animo omnes invadere hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inligare conisa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:9:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 9, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10319.5" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(parvi) conituntur sese ut erigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10319.6" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rursus ad surgendum coniti non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris ad convincendum eum conisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus imperii nervis ad revocandam pristinae disciplinam militiae conisus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10319.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n10319.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon, press toward, struggle toward, strive to reach;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of place: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus summum in jugum virtute conititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praealtam in arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—So <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of a weapon: <cit><quote lang="la">in hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:252" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 252</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem coepere locum conixa feruntur (primordia rerum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10319.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To struggle</hi> in giving birth, <hi rend="ital">to labor</hi> (cf. enitor): <cit><quote lang="la">spem gregis, ah! silice in nudā conixa reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10319.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of mental effort, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesto est domina omnium et regina, ratio, quae conixa per se et progressa longius, fit perfecta virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>putting forth her own energy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum coniti animo potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conitum: <entryFree id="n10320" type="main" key="conitum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conitum</orth>, v. coniptum.</entryFree>
conium: <entryFree id="n10321" type="greek" key="co_ni_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw/neion</foreign>, <sense id="n10321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hemlock</hi> (pure Lat. cicuta), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 3, 9</bibl>. <pb n="422" /> <cb n="CONJ" /></sense></entryFree>
coniventia: <entryFree id="n10322" type="main" key="co_ni_venti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnīventĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coniveo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">connivance</hi> (post-class. and rare): Ciceronis, Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (p. 152 Orell.); Cod.
